meanings.definition: A tropical palm tree native to Central and South America.
meanings.sent1: The corozo provides shade in the hot tropical climate.
meanings.sent2: Many colorful birds make their nests in the branches of the corozo.
meanings.sent3: The monkeys in the jungle love to swing from the corozo's sturdy branches.
meanings.sent4: The corozo stands tall like a guardian of the rainforest.
meanings.sent5: The leaves of the corozo rustle in the gentle breeze, creating a soothing sound.

meanings.definition: The small, hard-shelled fruit of the corozo palm.
meanings.sent1: The villagers collected the ripe corozos to make delicious jams.
meanings.sent2: Children enjoy cracking open the corozo to find the sweet flesh inside.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel stole a corozo and ran up the tree to eat it.
meanings.sent4: The corozo fruit fell to the ground with a satisfying thud.
meanings.sent5: The scent of ripe corozo filled the air, tempting all who passed by.

meanings.definition: A type of vegetable ivory derived from the seeds of the corozo palm.
meanings.sent1: Artisans carve intricate designs into corozo to create beautiful jewelry.
meanings.sent2: The smooth texture of corozo makes it a popular material for buttons.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer chose corozo buttons for their eco-friendly collection.
meanings.sent4: The creamy color of corozo resembles traditional ivory but without harm to animals.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of corozo against the skin adds a touch of nature to any outfit.
